articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia, one of the world's biggest oil producers, has faced shortages of fuel crucial for gathering the harvest in some parts of its southern breadbasket and the situation may get worse in coming months, market sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Russia faces domestic fuel crunch, braces for more shortages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is making $12 billion available in grants and loans for automakers and suppliers to retrofit their plants to produce electric and other advanced vehicles, Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm told reporters on Thursday.
articles.title: US offers $12 billion for automakers, suppliers to make advanced vehicles

articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Thursday as a keenly awaited report showed inflation was ebbing, fueling hopes the Federal Reserve could pause its monetary tightening, while Salesforce shares climbed on the company's upbeat revenue forecasts.
articles.title: Wall St gains as inflation data boosts rate-pause hopes

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. consumer spending increased by the most in six months in July as Americans bought more goods and services, but slowing monthly inflation rates cemented expectations that the Federal Reserve would keep interest rates unchanged next month.
articles.title: US consumer spending accelerates; declining savings a red flag

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of marijuana companies climbed as much as 14% in morning trading on Thursday after the Department of Health and Human Services recommended its reclassification as a lower-risk substance following an 11-month review.
articles.title: Pot firms gain as US move to ease curbs boosts sentiment

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly, Scott Disavino
articles.description: U.S. field production of crude oil rose 1.6% in June to 12.844 million barrels per day, the highest since February 2020, before the coronavirus pandemic destroyed demand for fuel and other oil products, the Energy Information Administration said on Thursday.
articles.title: US crude oil output rises in June to highest since Feb 2020 -EIA

articles.author: Foo Yun Chee
articles.description: Microsoft (MSFT.O) will unbundle its chat and video app Teams from its Office product and make it easier for rival products to work with its software, the U.S. company said on Thursday in a move aimed at staving off a possible EU antitrust fine.
articles.title: Microsoft to unbundle Teams from Office, seeks to avert EU antitrust fine

articles.author: Carien Du Plessis, Bhargav Acharya
articles.description: More than 70 people were killed overnight when a fire raged through a run-down, five-storey Johannesburg apartment block, one of the worst such disasters in a city where poverty, household fires and homelessness are widespread.
articles.title: Johannesburg fire: Scores killed as fire guts rundown apartment block

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A newly released video of Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin purports to show him in Africa only days before his death, addressing speculation about his wellbeing and possible threats to his security.
articles.title: Late Russian mercenary Prigozhin spoke about his security in newly surfaced video

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell "is medically clear to continue with his schedule as planned," the attending physician to the Congress said on Thursday, one day after McConnell froze up at an event in his home state of Kentucky.
articles.title: Top US Senate Republican Mitch McConnell 'medically clear' -physician
